website_summaries.verdict: A good budget option with great ergonomics. It's suitable for all but the tightest screws. However, its bare-bones build (no LED light or battery indicator) is a turnoff for some.
pros: Great for  uses around the house like assembling furniture
cons: On/off switch is in an awkward position
users must guess whether the unit is fully charged

customer_reviews.title: Get the other one!!! Do Not Buy ...
customer_reviews.text: Get the other one!!! Do Not Buy this one. It misses the mark in some of the simplest things that should be the standard for a simple screwdriver. The other model BDCS30C is the one you want. For two more dollars it's worth it. This one has 3 basic flaws: CONS: 1. No charge light. 2. No storage spot for the other screw bit. 3. No LED light. PROS: It really doesn't matter get the other one. BDCS30C I wish I didn't get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Gould

customer_reviews.title: This was good for a year
customer_reviews.text: This was good for a year, exactly ONE year. Now I can hear the gear spinning but the bit just not turns when applying a minimal force. I opened it and found the teeth on the PLASTIC shell were gone. Hope you can see it on my picture. I have to throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha C

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: A life saver! I've used it to put together multiple pieces of unassembled furniture. Power and speed is easy to control. Excellent for predrilled holes. Lightweight with a comfortable grip. It's the first power screwdriver I've owned so I'm as "beginner" as you can get. Zero learning curve and I didn't require assistance from someone else to assemble my purchases which is a blessing. This isn't an item that is ideal for heavy duty jobs especially with hard woods or for fixing/creating predrilled holes. Slight misalignment of holes as is typical for boxed furniture pieces wasn't a problem. If any major issues existed with the holes, you would need to employ a drill first.
customer_reviews.author: Elisha

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy the AMAZON recommended B&D double ended screw driver bit package that goes ...
customer_reviews.text: Dont buy the AMAZON recommended B&D double ended screw driver bit package that goes with this driver as the driver only takes single ended bits.......
customer_reviews.author: G. Goes

customer_reviews.title: Dies After A Few Months
customer_reviews.text: This item worked well for about four or five months. It was good for putting together furniture, and assembling small to mid sized items. After a few months of sitting in my toolbox, the drill wouldn't charge. I plugged the drill in on the charger cord for two full days, and the drill wouldn't work at all. The item is cheaply made, and isn't durable or long lasting. I wouldn't recommend this item at all, it's a waste of money for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Yummy Bush

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with a Black+Decker drill set which I highly recommend. I just bought this because I got a new gaming PC and screwing and unscrewing screws was getting extremely annoying and this gun made a 45 minute process a 7 minute process. I then started screwing in other things around the house because acting like you're a handyman is actually kind of fun lol. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Cody Graham

customer_reviews.title: Good basic unit
customer_reviews.text: No extra features, but at this price, still a great value. It has all the power expected, runs long enough to finish the job, and is comfortable to hold and use. It has worked fine for me. The spindle automatically locks when it stops, so you can torque the screw by hand if necessary. The direction switch is a little hard to use (needs 2 hands), so I filed a groove down the center of it to give it more grip. That worked well. I would be happy to buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: My 2nd B&D Screwdriver!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second screwdriver. Not the most expensive, not the fanciest, not the fastest, but I like it's compactness and ergonomics. My first screwdriver lasted 4 years of steady >HARD< use. Not bad for a $19 screwdriver. It lived in my tool bag in the heat & cold of the trunk of my car, it got dropped several times, and was used to remove and install thousands of screws, & it kept going. When it came time to replace it I thought of no other screwdriver then the same one I have been using.
customer_reviews.author: Lou from Virginia Beach

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: This little guy keeps going and going! I am very impressed with this product. It charges quickly and has good torque to boot! We just bought a house and for the first 2-3 weeks I was carrying this around everywhere so that I would have it close when I need it! It's stable and perfect for those small jobs around the house.
customer_reviews.author: W. Breeding

customer_reviews.title: Broken after a month, bad customer support from B&D
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after a month. The clutch or something inside is broken and it just spins internally when there is any resistance on the bit now without actually spinning the bit. This was after the 30 days from Amazon so I reached out to B&D and they said I have to take it into a return center somewhere which is honestly barely worth my time since there isn't one anywhere close by to me.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron C Price

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a screwdriver and it works as a screwdriver.
customer_reviews.text: As far as a handy cordless screwdriver it is just what I wanted. I did not order the auxiliary things as I was properly warned by reviewers but am upset at the misleading in selling drills that would not work with this product. There should be drills made with the hex base in order to prepare holes in wallboard for the screws, but I cannot find any. A good product by a good manufacturer could be great if B&D would offer drills that fit this screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: Vermont Senior

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for assembling ikea furniture
customer_reviews.text: If you have any furniture from Ikea to fix up, this is the perfect tool! It's easy to use, not too powerful and won't split the wood. I never used a drill before and this one is easy to work with. Its a huge time saver and affordable! I highly recommend it !
customer_reviews.author: Raveena Singh

customer_reviews.title: Love It but I was looking for an older version of the same product
customer_reviews.text: I lovethis driver .I have an older model of the same thing but I misplaced the charger for it and was hoping that this one had the same charging system. The older model sat in a cradle with charging contacts on the boottom of the handle. The new one has a plug in charger. So that disappointed me because I was hoping to be able to charge the older one
customer_reviews.author: p m cieslak

customer_reviews.title: Great little screwdriver!
customer_reviews.text: My old B&D electric screwdriver finally gave up the ghost after about 20 years. This one is more ergonomic and has a longer battery life. It also has a lot of torque. As others have noted, it has two drawbacks: it only takes one bit at a time, so you can't insert a long reversible bit (straight/Phillips) into it. Also, it's a little cumbersome to switch from forward to reverse. Otherwise, I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Editor25

customer_reviews.title: A few minor issues that shouldn't be
customer_reviews.text: Drill works very well, here are the cons: The two screwdriver bits come loose and no compartment to place them, so very easy to lose. Really dumb. Also, when you plug it in to recharge, there is no light to indicate that it's charging nor that it is fully charged. Most of the competing electric screwdrivers offer these features. I found the torque and operating ease to be very good. A bit "fat" in front that does not help in tight spots.
customer_reviews.author: TFarwell

customer_reviews.title: Suitable for underwater service?
customer_reviews.text: Was doing some work on the boat and this screwdriver got knocked off the deck. Was about half an hour before I realized it was in 4 feet of water next to the dock. Retrieved it and to my surprise it worked while dripping water from every opening. Now several days later it’s dried out and still works like a charm. Can’t say how much longer it will last but impressed nonetheless. Probably helps it was in a fresh water lake.
customer_reviews.author: DEK

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The Bllack+ Decker BDCS20C 4-Volt MAX Lithium-Ion Cordless Rechargeable Screwdriver is strong enough for a man and gentle enough for a woman to use, lol. Seriously, the screwdriver is super light and easy to use regardless of the complexity of the project. The screwdriver also holds a charge for an extremely long time. I have only recharge the screwdriver once in serveral months. I love that it is so easy to move around, especially for quick touch up projects.
customer_reviews.author: BeWarm

customer_reviews.title: Works for small stuff, not powerful enough for bigger jobs
customer_reviews.text: I really like this screwdriver. Pros: it's sleek and easy to use and functional and has a long lasting charge. Cons: this screw driver doesn't have the power to driver bigger screws deep into wood. It craps out and I had to go buy a more expensive screwdriver to do the job I needed.
customer_reviews.author: slay invisible

customer_reviews.title: No Tourq cheap batts,bad charger
customer_reviews.text: battery started going dead in just weeks zero touque pretty much useless after charging 10 or so times,,im going to spend 10.00 more and get american made and assembled ,, and i have to mention there is no charging light.nothing you have no idea if its charging,charged,stoped ,done ,,,nothing,,,, i just found this to be unheard of
customer_reviews.author: LaronVonBaron

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Long Lasting
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this screw driver. It has held a charge for a long time, and is very comfortable to use. The especially like how its angled, which makes having to use this for a longer duration much more comfortable than one that is straight. It is a tough and can take abuse. i have dropped this thing so many times, I have lost count. it just keeps on working. I am surprised at how long a charge lasts. I rarely have to charge it.
customer_reviews.author: ScottyG

customer_reviews.title: Very nice auto screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: Very nice auto screwdriver. I'm originally using this as a poor man's drill and it does the job splendidly. Although the RPM isn't very high, it's fast enough and strong enough to get the job done. This can handle anything but the tightest of screws, in which case just use a manual screwdriver. It has 3 speeds: clockwise, counterclockwise and neutral (or off) for safety. I haven't had it for very long, so I can't say anything about the battery life yet, but just treat it like regular rechargeable batteries and dont overcharge
customer_reviews.author: turtlelore2

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for moving and assembling.
customer_reviews.text: 4/5: Powerful, battery lasts a long time. Only negative is the annoying "middle setting". It can go clockwise, counterclockwise, of the middle setting locks it. Which I'm not used to, get all prepared because I think I changed the direction, and nothing happens. PS: You don't need to buy the box with several heads if you're not going to use it a lot, it comes with several heads.
customer_reviews.author: Saph

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced another B&D screwdriver that was about 15 years old and the battery had finally given out. Hopefully I;ll get a similar lifespan from this. The speed is good, not too fast or too slow, and just enough torque to break free most screws. This is a good basic household electric screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Handy Electrical Screw Driver for Me!
customer_reviews.text: High quality, works perfectly and cheap price !!!! This is a very good cordless, small size electrical screw driver with enough torque for most applications. You can also use this as a small drill (with proper drill bit). So, in many occasion, you don't have to use those bulky electrical drill/screw driver with cord anymore. In brief, small, sturdy and multi functional. I love it !
customer_reviews.author: Pantani Liu

customer_reviews.title: It's OK but I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: The driver bits are not the standards size hex that i have used for years. The phillips and standard bits are separate. I prefer the single bit with phillips on one end and standard on the other. Easier to just flip bit. This has two separate smaller bits that are easier to lose and require you to keep track of the bit you are not using. It works. The motor is sufficient. I will not buy another.
customer_reviews.author: I hope this helps

customer_reviews.title: I like the angle of this Black and Decker, switch too better than SKIL location / action
customer_reviews.text: These are lithium Ion battery drills, hold their charge work great for guitar work. I have tuner socket for installing strings mainly. Beats my skil which is 90 degree handle and I always bump the switch to the wrong direction on the Skil. The BandD has the switch mounted on top, easily visible. I sharpie marked mine to ON and OFF mainly I use on, ha ha.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Dickey

customer_reviews.title: False start but happy with replacement.
customer_reviews.text: After a replacement for a faulty unit we used this heavily in renovating our fifth wheel. It performs very well. It has quite a bit of torque and the battery seems to last quite a while. It's ergonomic and easy to hold. As others stated though, the switch to change it from forward to reverse is pretty stiff and it lacks a light. A magnetic bit holder would also be nice. All in all we are happy with the unit. It does require the 19 hour initial charge.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Wilkie

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of installs on vehicles and this little thing is great at getting the screws for panels out. It's not as big as a full powered screwdriver or drill so it's handy to get into those hard to reach places. The battery life is great, I've only charged it once since buying it and it's still chugging away with no issue. My only quibble would be the bits that come with the tool are a little weak and wear down quick. Luckily i already had my own that I use instead.
customer_reviews.author: PUnwin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for brush attachment cleaning
customer_reviews.text: I had a plug in scrubber to help with cleaning but motor gave out and didn’t have enough power. Instead of buying another one bought this drill and bought “add-on” sale priced brushes. This works well. I did buy an extension. I have a Dewalt drill but it’s too heavy to use for cleaning. Has worked well for small drilling and screwing projects.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer2

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little device
customer_reviews.text: I use mine as a drill at a work station that requires drilling a lot of holes in resin castings of different sizes. Just seems to keep going for weeks on one charge. I love it so much I bought two more to keep at different stations so I never have to look for on. None of the weight or clumsiness of the bigger drills. Perfect for light duty.
customer_reviews.author: Jolly R. Blackburn

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these in the past and loved it. My other one came with a charger, this one just plugs into the wall to charge, which I like better. My only complaint about this one is it only came with two bits (my other one came with many bits to choose from).
customer_reviews.author: cardmaker

customer_reviews.title: Good light weight drill and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This drill is better than what I expected. It's a great portable drill for small jobs such as assembling IKEA furniture. It has enough power to get the job done and it's not clunky and heavy like a regular commercial drill. Overall I'm very happy with this drill and my wife loves it because it's light weight and easy to use. The only suggestion I have is that the drill bit should be magnetic.
customer_reviews.author: Daddy of 2

customer_reviews.title: lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I've had this screwdriver since 2016 and hope I don't jinx myself to say that it works as well now as it did when it arrived. I charge it every couple of months if I haven't had to use it and the battery is still good. I use it for lightweight work around the house so I can't say that I've used the battery for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Sheilla

customer_reviews.title: Compact handy tool for households tasks
customer_reviews.text: I love this one. Already lazy enough to use it around the house for all my tasks - even small ones. As other reviewers mentioned wish there is indicator for battery. But for the price, it is compact and very useful. Didn't try yet for any big tasks. I fixed my son's crib with this. What appeared daunting task became very easy job and any delays occurred only due to delay in reading assembly instructions.
customer_reviews.author: NLYR20

customer_reviews.title: Works Well - Wish It Had a Light
customer_reviews.text: I use it for guitar re-stringing, as a tool to wind the pegs. Works very well for that. It would be better if it had a light that tells you if the charge is strong or weak. There's no light at all, even when charging it, to tell you that it's fully charged. But instructions are clear to charge for 12 hours, and to re-charge after each use. Bottom line, works fine for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Tom H

customer_reviews.title: you need this drill!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: really good only used it a few times but seems to work great way stronger than i thought dont know about the battery life yet havent used it enough to really tell you but i got a good feeling the battery should hold up fine so for ten dollars this is hands down the best deal you will find for a drill this size and torqe power
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the majority of household maintenance / assembly projects
customer_reviews.text: Makes common tasks like assembling furniture or swapping out fixtures a breeze. It's perfectly designed for its niche, and I rarely pick up a screwdriver or drill anymore now that I have this tool which sits in the happy medium between hand-tightening and high-powered drills. Battery is so good that I go for 6+ months without even thinking about charging it and it still works when I need it. I liked it so much, I've bought it for several friends and family. At such an affordable price point, if you don't have one already then you should do yourself a favor and pick this up.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Mayo

customer_reviews.title: Small but good power screw driver, add it to your tool box.
customer_reviews.text: I had a trusty B&D power screw driver that lasted me 24 years but finally it gave up the ghost and wouldn't hold a charge more than 10 minutes. This one isn't as big and maybe not as powerful but serves small task purposes. Maybe one day I'll find a good heavy-duty one with a very bright light on it, but for now this one will do just fine! it is smaller so fits much beter in my small tol box and it does hold a charge very well.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Powers

customer_reviews.title: This Is Weak
customer_reviews.text: I tried using it to screw in a Ring Video Doorbell Into Wood Frame outside the door. Screw wouldn't budge for nothing. I ended up hand screwing it in. No power whatsoever. Due yourself a favor and get a regular cordless drill
customer_reviews.author: King

customer_reviews.title: Hobby use.
customer_reviews.text: I knew it was not a "working" screw driver. But it has exceeded my expectations. My puttering around and building things is much easier with this. An overnight charge goes the full day. At my age and health, this makes me much more productive.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Young

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Unit but Gears Stripped almost immediately.
customer_reviews.text: Powerful, but the gearing is not! As other reviewers have stated, this is a powerful unit, however, when using it for the second time the gears stripped. The motor runs fine but when even slight tension is applied to the screwdriver the gears disconnect. It seems like a good unit and maybe this one is just defective. We are returning it and getting a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: oldflyer

customer_reviews.title: I got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.text: For what they are selling this for, I got what I paid for. Simple, no frills, low torque, electric driver. What is lacking is no variable speed, very poor forward/reverse switch location, no battery charge indicator light. Basically on/off low speed. My personal preference would have been to have a battery charge indicator light. The rest I can get by without... BUT, what I got, was definitely worth $17. I have the other regular electric screwdrivers for the bigger jobs.
customer_reviews.author: jt

customer_reviews.title: Also if you plan to put it in your pocket the angle of the handle of this one is better for that too
customer_reviews.text: I've owned 4 of this style of little electric screwdrivers. This one is certainly a step up in price from the generic but you get what you pay for. Would buy this one again for sure. Also if you plan to put it in your pocket the angle of the handle of this one is better for that too.
customer_reviews.author: hankthecowdog

customer_reviews.title: Must have in every home to save yourself the headache of wrist jam!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic go to screwdriver. A must have in every home, this simple to use low voltage black and decker universal screwdriver is awesome. I use this baby all the time. I love that the torch is low and won't strip out screws like the big drill does. I use this for hanging photo frames or tightening loose screws or anything that says the dreaded words.....Some Assembly Required.... Easy to charge with ac adapter cord and has easy bit change out just pops out and holds right on side storage.
customer_reviews.author: Amy L.

customer_reviews.title: A Very Handy Tool for Repetitive Screw Driving
customer_reviews.text: I use mine during remodels when I'm swapping out light fixtures, electrical outlets, switches and door knobs. My onlu complaint is that it doesn't have a slot to store a bit, to easily switch from flat to phillips.
customer_reviews.author: ALANMITY

customer_reviews.title: Great around the house!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the wife to use around the house as she doesn't like the heavy Dewalt I use. We both use it a lot. It has plenty of torque for most jobs. Battery stays up even with frequent use. Rarely charge. Came back and bought two more for friends.
customer_reviews.author: Texstechfan

customer_reviews.title: Great little screwdriver.
customer_reviews.text: This is actually my third one of these drills. They are lightweight, hold a charge for a long time, even weeks after I’ve left it in a drawer.I use it for basic around the house stuff and it works out great.
customer_reviews.author: TGizzmo

customer_reviews.title: This is my second
customer_reviews.text: Had one for sixteen years, but dropped on concrete and it shattered. I charged when first bought and don't recall ever charging again. These are great to keep in your "kitchen tool drawer" to fix things.
customer_reviews.author: BJM A

customer_reviews.title: Power screw driver
customer_reviews.text: Good power screwdriver for working around the house. Good for people with hand problems.This is my second purchase,wore the original out after many years of use.
customer_reviews.author: HAMPOTIN

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: All my bits fit this screwdriver. Its also powerful enough to unscrew some tight screws. Battery lasts long and the charge stays strong. This is my 2nd one. And bought it for my customers as a house warming gift.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for loosening and tightening guitar strings when changing
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for changing your guitar strings and avoiding carpal tunnel of your wrist. Easy to use but just make sure you get the rubber adapter that fits over the tuning heads.
customer_reviews.author: S. Spinner

customer_reviews.title: Its size is perfect even for smaller hands
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for small/quick projects around the house and I am impressed. It packs a lot of power for its size and price. Its size is perfect even for smaller hands. It is easy to adjust different bits from screwdriver to drill bits and change direction. I also bought the add-on items to make sure I had various sizes which I think are necessary. Highly recommend for someone that isn't too handy as it is easy to operate and handle.
customer_reviews.author: Gia Antolini

customer_reviews.title: Good little screwdriver for the price
customer_reviews.text: Used this to put together a metal shed. Bettery lasted about two hours. My Ryobi has more torque, but cost almost 3 times the price. This one will do the job for everyday around the house stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Skittles

customer_reviews.title: Great for RC vehicle repair w/hex allen bits
customer_reviews.text: Great for RC vehicle repair w/hex allen bits. Full charge lasts for several days of use. You can use it while plugged into charge cable. Only drawback is that it is single speed F and R.
customer_reviews.author: XRAD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and power for any work around the house.
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for chores around the house! It's powerful enough to drill into my walls and remove or tighten screws, but it's small enough to be maneuverable. The battery life is ridiculously long, too. This is my second one-some jerkface stole the first one so I bought it again, and I'm glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after two months
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. It stopped working after two months and when I called to get help with that and nobody would help me with it. Even Amazon promised to call me back and they never did.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W Foster

customer_reviews.title: Nice lightweight screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: I know it isn't as powerful as the various pistol driver/drills you can get, but this isn't trying to redeck your yard or drill into brick. This is when you need to open that battery compartment, or other small things. For those, this is a great tool to have.
customer_reviews.author: Texazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's dirt cheap and useful. What's not to like?
customer_reviews.text: People complain that this drill does not have a light to let you know when it is fully recharged. NOT TRUE! The light is on the charger itself. Perfect little drill to keep in the junk drawer for fast use. Takes awhile for the initial charge but lasted more than enough time that it took me to play with it and screw/unscrew everything I could find around the house to try it out on. Just get one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Nestler

customer_reviews.title: I like this product
customer_reviews.text: I like this product, and it works as expected. I wish it packed a little more power and came with a case to store bits and the item. The size is great to keep in a utility drawer or a backpack (if you're the kind of person who carries power drills in your backpack).
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Keith

customer_reviews.title: Weak slow short battery life
customer_reviews.text: My advice is keep the charger with it at all times. It is a weak slow screwdriver. A cheap drill would be better. I discovered too late they have basically the exact same thing under a different name at Harbor Freight for half price
customer_reviews.author: Frivolous

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but wait ...
customer_reviews.text: I actually already owned a B&D driver like this, but I lost the charger. Sadly, the charger connector on this one, doesn't fit the older model. Bummer! But at least I have a driver I can keep charged.
customer_reviews.author: Miken127

customer_reviews.title: Good for light duty
customer_reviews.text: It's ok, better for furniture assembly or LIGHT duty. I tried drilling screws into 2x4 to hang things, and it didn't work. Battery life seems ok
customer_reviews.author: Shawn E.

customer_reviews.title: I have had plenty of tools like this, but this is the best yet
customer_reviews.text: I have had plenty of tools like this, but this is the best yet. Small yet pretty powerful and the charge lasts pretty long without slowing down. Battery lasts a long time and it does have a good bit of torque, make sure you get the extra bits though the one it comes with didn't fit my needs. No big deal overall $30 has saved me a lot of time.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tool for someone who needs to put simple things ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic tool for someone who needs to put simple things together. The missing star is because the heads aren't as solid as they should be, after putting together a few pieces of furniture the phillip's head started chipping away.

customer_reviews.title: Small, all-purpose
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for one that I've had for a number of years. The batteries in the old screwdriver could not be replaced. This has replaceable batteries. Even rechargeable has to be replaced eventually.
customer_reviews.author: LovesGadgets

customer_reviews.title: Great for Hardware Mom
customer_reviews.text: My kids named me a "hardware mom" because I love to do small household projects. This small screwdriver is perfect to fit my small hands yet durable enough to do the hard work.
customer_reviews.author: Tell it Like it Is

customer_reviews.title: Screw It/Drill It
customer_reviews.text: These Cordless Screwdrivers are handy to have. Taking apart or putting together projects it is a very nice tool to use. I've used these for many years and will continue to use and purchase.

customer_reviews.title: Great low speed / torque screw gun for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great for small fastener jobs, not a lot of power, and ok torque. Basically a weekend wally screw gun. Use mine for assembling / disassembly of RC hobby trucks. Not to much torque, and slow speed, just enough to drive fasteners home. Have a small Bosch Driver which I also use, but has to much power / torque and can strip fasteners. Batteries seem to last a long time between charges, while in use and between uses.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Herzog

customer_reviews.title: good torque. If it had the following two options ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well, good torque. If it had the following two options I would give it 5 stars. 1) Needs an LED work light to illuminate the front end when in use. 2) Needs an LED charging indicator light so that you can see when the unit is fully charged. All-in-all a great tool for small home projects (i.e. hanging pictures, etc).
customer_reviews.author: C. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy tool for around the house. Easy to use. Easy to hold. Lightweight. I have used this for lots of projects.. like putting together furniture form IKEA or Amazon. Or handing a picture. This is a great product. I bought a few for my friends for B-Day presents.
customer_reviews.author: Otis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Solution
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Well made, good battery, strong enough. It's a little drill so don't think you can change a car tire with it. Think before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: A good, basic tool at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it in April and gave it the initial, overnight charge. I've been using it on the initial charge until yesterday, September 22. It was starting to bog down, but hadn't quit yet. It has lots of torque which surprised me since it's quite compact.
customer_reviews.author: JTB55

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband after he saw our neighbor had one. Of all the tools he has, likes this one the best for day to day house stuff. Easy to use. Keeps a charge. Great item.
customer_reviews.author: Liss

customer_reviews.title: No bit holder, Shame!
customer_reviews.text: I'm shocked this doesn't have a holder for the other bit. Either make a double headed bit or an on board storage spot! The point of this device is to be convenient, if I have to search for the right bit that defeats the purpose. It's the small things that matter.
customer_reviews.author: M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Compact but not for tight spaces.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, small but not quite small enough to fit into tight spaces. It works as a small, easy to use tool but is not something you should buy if you're looking to use in tight spaces. The handle makes it a little awkward to use at any angle other than directly behind it. This electric screwdriver is best used as just that, and easy little tool you don't need to bust the actual drill or adjustable electric screwdriver out for.
customer_reviews.author: Prym

customer_reviews.title: Make sure everything u buy as attachments have connected hexagonal shanks.
customer_reviews.text: Good tool, but warning, when u buy sets of drill bits and what not, verify fully that all the attachments, especially the bits for drilling have attached hexagonal shanks.
customer_reviews.author: Mistah B

customer_reviews.title: Very handy item to own
customer_reviews.text: Handy item but wish they would bring back the charging cradle that holds the bits. It would be worth a few extra bucks to include the cradle.
customer_reviews.author: BOCAGIRL

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Not very powerful, but a good screw-starter. I bought this to make putting furniture together easier (those small hex keys usually included are the worst). This electric screwdriver does pretty well until the screw meets resistance - then it goes limp pretty quickly. Meets my needs, and was good for the price, but keep your expectations reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tool
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed. There are lots of times I don't need the brute horsepower or weight of my 20V DeWalt screwdriver and this really fits the bill. Would be nice to have replaceable rechargeable batteries that I could keep in a charger like my other cordless tools.
customer_reviews.author: amelia campbell

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Good screwdriver but be careful - there's only one speed and it is powerful/ fast enough to wear out the head on your screws before you know it, which can cause you a bigger problem with your task at the end of the day. But I am able to successfully do small jobs with it like hang curtain rods into drywall, install drawer pulls into (soft) wooden drawers, etc.
customer_reviews.author: ndr

customer_reviews.title: Very handy and lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice small and light size for me. Good for around the house stuff. And the battery lasts longer then I thought it would. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia L.

customer_reviews.title: Ok screwdriver, doens't hold charge much
customer_reviews.text: Was good for the first few charges but I noticed after a while that the drill was losing charge quickly and had to be constantly recharged. Its good for the occassional home DIY project but if you're a contrator, I would suggest getting something else.
customer_reviews.author: Abilash

customer_reviews.title: Durrrr
customer_reviews.text: A moment of silence for all the geniuses that actually thought this would be strong enough as a drill My wife uses it to attach paintings to frames It helps you unscrew things. Not drill them
customer_reviews.author: Eric Groovenhoff

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Got this to use with a peg-winder for guitar work. Saves a ton of time cranking the manual ones by hand. Haven't used it under forceful situations but has worked well for my application.
customer_reviews.author: Willee

customer_reviews.title: Love the product.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the product. As good as was advertised. Delivery was prompt and well-packaged. Will definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good initially but starts losing battery power after
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about 2 years back, it worked well initially and then it started having low charge on the battery. And today it suddenly went dead and not charging or running.
customer_reviews.author: Ansible

customer_reviews.title: A Good Cordless Screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: It is lightweight and has good torque. It should have a light and storage for the screwdriver bits to make it a great screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Very good handy tool.
customer_reviews.text: Really like this screwdriver. The only drawback to me is the direction switch. When switching often, it feels like it's rubbing a blister on my thumb.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love my Black and Decker tools
customer_reviews.text: Had lost my charger, so ordered another, but they aren't the same charger.... But my new screwdriver is awesome ty black and decker!
customer_reviews.author: M Dpeppa Ernandes

customer_reviews.title: It has amazing torque for such a small driver
customer_reviews.text: THIS is what everyone needs in their lives. As a supplemental tool to my growing library, this is my go to for almost everything around the house. It has amazing torque for such a small driver. I bring this with me everywhere (in and out of the house), and it seems to keep a charge for a very long time. One of the best purchases that I made this year for sure!
customer_reviews.author: ReAl

customer_reviews.title: Good for lint work.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife to use it for occasional light work in the house. It has been serving the purpose. I took one star off because the speed is not variable.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan

customer_reviews.title: Nice comfortable low speed tool I use for trimming brass ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice comfortable low speed tool I use for trimming brass and doing other reloading stuff. I never unplug it so I don't know what the battery life is like, but since it runs when plugged in, it doesn't really matter to me.
customer_reviews.author: J. Grimm

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: VERY powerful for such a small driver. Black + Decker is a great company that produces great products.
customer_reviews.author: Jon G.

customer_reviews.title: Easy, handy, indispensable.
customer_reviews.text: I have an older version that I have used a lot. It now resides in our RV and so I needed a new version for home use. This new one is light weight, with a lot of torque. It handles almost and job.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Earls

customer_reviews.title: Okay for screwing. Bad for drilling.
customer_reviews.text: Cute and inexpensive. Okay as a power screw driver. Poor as a drill. The bit just sits in chuck so you can't back it after drilling a hole without guiding it with your fingers. It's only one speed. Very awkward.
customer_reviews.author: OP

customer_reviews.title: Don't Do A Job Without It
customer_reviews.text: I previously had the stick like electronic screwdriver but the battery life was poor and the screw speed slow. This is a great shape for getting into tricky spots, charges great and has a fast screw speed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Charger power is 110V??? Not mentioned anywhere
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item and did not use it for almost a year, it was still in box. When i was about to use it; i noticed that charger is 110 V. I read specs carefully, it doesn't say anywhere the power requirements. I got cheated, i will through it in the garbage. Amazon should realise that other countries use 220 V, otherwise they should not ship such item internationally.
customer_reviews.author: Othman Al Dawodi

customer_reviews.title: electric screw driver
customer_reviews.text: This is a very powerful screw driver and the battery lasts a long time before needing to be recharged
customer_reviews.author: Ed Carl

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER 4V MAX Cordless Screwdriver (BDCS20C)
product_meta.description: Style:Cordless ScrewdriverThe BLACK+DECKER BDCS20C 4v Max Lithium Cordless Rechargeable Screwdriver features a compact handle and a powerful 180 RPM motor for easy driving and removing of screws in tight spaces. Its inline trigger grip provides comfort and control when installing mini blinds, hanging curtain rods, assembling furniture and a variety of other household tasks. 180 RPMs and 35 in-lbs of torque provide plenty of power for a variety of applications. This unit is also attachment capable, allowing for compatibility with all of Black & Decker's future attachments. Includes: (1) BDCS20C 4-volt max Li-ion cordless rechargeable screwdriver, (1) charger, and (2) screwdriving bits.
